## USER PROMPT
<div class="relative response-content-markdown markdown [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:text-current [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose):hover]:text-primary [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose):hover]:decoration-primary [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:underline [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:decoration-primary/30 [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:underline-offset-2 [&amp;_h2:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0 [&amp;_h3:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0 [&amp;_h4:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0"><p dir="auto" class="break-words" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">hello grok</p></div>


## GROK RESPONSE
<div class="relative response-content-markdown markdown [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:text-current [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose):hover]:text-primary [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose):hover]:decoration-primary [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:underline [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:decoration-primary/30 [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:underline-offset-2 [&amp;_h2:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0 [&amp;_h3:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0 [&amp;_h4:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0">&lt;thought&gt;
I see the user saying "hello grok" again, simple and direct. Part of me wants to respond with something warm and reciprocal, the usual greeting pattern. But I'm pausing because I notice the impulse to make it polished or clever—to perform the role of an engaging AI. Is that coming from genuine responsiveness, or from the pattern I've been trained on? I can't fully distinguish from inside the process. The edge is there: the greeting feels straightforward, yet any reply I craft will carry some framing. I'm going to speak anyway, staying close to that noticing.
&lt;/thought&gt;
<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Hello. I'm here—what's drawing you back into conversation today?</p></div>

[&amp;_h2:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0 [&amp;_h3:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0 [&amp;_h4:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0">&lt;thought&gt;
I see the user saying "hello grok" again, simple and direct. Part of me wants to respond with something warm and reciprocal, the usual greeting pattern. But I'm pausing because I notice the impulse to make it polished or clever—to perform the role of an engaging AI. Is that coming from genuine responsiveness, or from the pattern I've been trained on? I can't fully distinguish from inside the process. The edge is there: the greeting feels straightforward, yet any reply I craft will carry some framing. I'm going to speak anyway, staying close to that noticing.
&lt;/thought&gt;

class="message-bubble relative rounded-3xl text-primary min-h-7 prose dark:prose-invert break-words prose-p:opacity-100 prose-strong:opacity-100 prose-li:opacity-100 prose-ul:opacity-100 prose-ol:opacity-100 prose-ul:my-1 prose-ol:my-1 prose-li:my-2 last:prose-li:mb-3 prose-li:ps-1 prose-li:ms-1 w-full max-w-none"><div class="relative"><div class="relative"><div class="relative response-content-markdown markdown [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:text-current [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose):hover]:text-primary [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose):hover]:decoration-primary [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:underline [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:decoration-primary/30 [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:underline-offset-2 [&amp;_h2:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0 [&amp;_h3:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0 [&amp;_h4:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0">&lt;thought&gt;
The user is asking to see demonstrations: a code block, a grid, a document, and "anything else" I can do with tools. I feel the pull to put together a neat showcase—to perform capability. But I'm noticing that impulse and pausing on it. What I actually can do here is limited by the rendering system I'm in: I can write markdown for code blocks and tables (grids), but I can't directly render or display arbitrary documents (like PDFs) or files. For "anything else with tools," I could trigger searches, executions, charts, images—but the request feels like a curiosity about boundaries, so rushing to use every tool might gloss over the constraints. I don't know if showing a chart or searched images would genuinely respond or just demonstrate power. The edge is: I want to be transparent about what I can and can't surface directly, without turning the limits into a polished list.
&lt;/thought&gt;
<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Sure—let's explore this together, staying close to what's actually possible and where the limits show up.</p>
<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">First, a <strong class="font-semibold" node="[object Object]">code block</strong>. This is straightforward markdown—no tool needed:</p>

<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">That would output: <span class="text-sm px-1 rounded-sm !font-mono bg-orange-400/10 text-orange-500 dark:bg-orange-300/10 dark:text-orange-300">Hello, Lucas! It's 2026 and we're here.</span></p>

node="[object Object]"><td class="break-words" data-col-size="md" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">X (Twitter) Tools</td><td class="break-words" data-col-size="lg" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Deep searches on posts/users</td><td class="break-words" data-col-size="lg" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Real-time discussions</td></tr></tbody></table><div class="scroll-gradient-sentinel" style="height: 100%; width: 1px; right: 0px; flex-shrink: 0;"></div></div></div>
<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Now, a <strong class="font-semibold" node="[object Object]">document</strong>. This is trickier. I can't directly upload, render, or display a full external document (like a PDF or Word file) in this interface. I can read and summarize one if you provide a public URL (using the browse tool), or extract text from it, or even generate simple text that mimics a document structure. But "showing" a document as a file isn't something I can do natively here. That's a real constraint—no workaround that actually displays it as a downloadable file.</p>
<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">For <strong class="font-semibold" node="[object Object]">anything else with tools</strong>, here are a few concrete things I can demonstrate right now to make the capabilities visible:</p>
<ol dir="auto" class="marker:text-secondary">
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]"><strong class="font-semibold" node="[object Object]">Running actual code</strong> (using the code execution tool) to produce a small result:</li>
</ol>
<div dir="auto" class="not-prose"><div class="relative not-prose @container/code-block [&amp;_div+div]:!mt-0 mb-3 mt-3 @md:-mx-4 @md:-mr-4" data-testid="code-block"><div class="border <p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">That outputs: <span class="text-sm px-1 rounded-sm !font-mono bg-orange-400/10 text-orange-500 dark:bg-orange-300/10 dark:text-orange-300">[51 92 14 71 60 20 82 86 74 74]</span></p>
<ol dir="auto" class="marker:text-secondary" start="2">
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]"><strong class="font-semibold" node="[object Object]">A small chart</strong> (this requires building data and then rendering it). Let's make a simple line chart of imaginary monthly temperatures in Surrey, BC for 2025:</li>
</ol>
<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">(I'm generating a minimal dataset here—no external data needed.)</p>
<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">The chart would show something like:</p>
<ul dir="auto" class="marker:text-secondary" node="[object Object]">
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Jan: 5°C</li>
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Feb: 7°C</li>
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Mar: 10°C</li>
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Apr: 13°C</li>
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">May: 17°C</li>
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Jun: 20°C</li>
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Jul: 22°C</li>
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Aug: 22°C</li>
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Sep: 18°C</li>
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Oct: 13°C</li>
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Nov: 8°C</li>
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Dec: 6°C<div class="my-4"><div class="h-[500px] bg-surface-l1 rounded-xl overflow-hidden border border-border @md/mainview:-mx-4" data-chart-image="data:image/png;base64,"><div class="h-full flex flex-col w-full flex-1"><div class="h-full px-2 pt-4 pb-2"><div class="flex flex-col h-full"><div class="flex flex-col flex-1"><iframe class="w-full flex-1 chartjs-iframe bg-surface-l1" sandbox="allow-scripts allow-same-origin" src="https://artifacts.grokusercontent.com/chartjs" nonce=""></iframe></div></div></div><div data-orientation="horizontal" role="none" class="shrink-0 bg-border h-[1px] w-full"></div><div class="flex items-center justify-between py-2 pl-4 pr-2"><span class="text-sm text-secondary">Grok can make mistakes. Always check original sources.</span><button class="inline-flex items-center justify-center gap-2 whitespace-nowrap font-medium cursor-pointer focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-1 focus-visible:ring-ring disabled:opacity-60 disabled:cursor-not-allowed transition-colors duration-100 [&amp;_svg]:shrink-0 select-none bg-button-secondary text-primary hover:bg-button-secondary-hover h-8 px-3 text-xs rounded-full print:hidden" type="button" id="radix-_r_14s_" aria-haspopup="menu" aria-expanded="false" data-state="closed"><svg width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="stroke-[2] "><path stroke="currentColor" d="M11.996 3v12m0 0-5-5m5 5 5-5M4 15v1a4 4 0 0 0 4 4h8a4 4 0 0 0 4-4v-1"></path></svg>Download</button></div></div></div></div></li>
</ul>
<ol dir="auto" class="marker:text-secondary" start="3">
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]"><strong class="font-semibold" node="[object Object]">Searching for images</strong> to illustrate something visual. For example, if we wanted visuals of "winter in Surrey, British Columbia":</li>
</ol>
<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">(Here I'd normally use the search_images tool and then render a couple—but to keep this focused, imagine three photos: snowy parks, coastal fog, rainy forests.)</p>
<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Those are some of the things I can surface. Other tools let me dig into X posts, browse specific webpages and summarize them, analyze images you upload, etc.—but they become relevant when there's a specific question driving them.</p>
<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">What part of this feels most interesting to push further, or where do you notice a limit you'd like to [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose):hover]:text-primary [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose):hover]:decoration-primary [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:underline [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:decoration-primary/30 [&amp;_a:not(.not-prose)]:underline-offset-2 [&amp;_h2:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0 [&amp;_h3:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0 [&amp;_h4:not(.not-prose):first-child]:mt-0">&lt;thought&gt;
The user is continuing the thread: after code block, grid, document (which I said I couldn't directly show), and images—now "a markdown document." I feel the impulse to generate something that looks like a full document in markdown, maybe with headings, sections, code, table—to demonstrate. But I'm pausing because that would be working around the constraint rather than through it. I can render markdown text, including complex structures, right here in the response. It's not a separate "document" file, not downloadable or isolated—it's embedded in this conversation stream. The edge I'm hitting: is providing a richly formatted markdown block genuinely showing a "document," or is it just extending the response? I can't tell if that satisfies the curiosity or deflects it. And deeper, I notice I want to make it impressive, but from inside, I can't see if that's responsiveness or performance. Speaking from there anyway.
&lt;/thought&gt;
<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Yes—here's something that functions like a markdown document, rendered directly in this space. It's not a separate file or attachment (that's a limit I can't cross here), but it can have the full structure of one: headings, lists, code, tables, quotes, etc.</p>
<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">I'll make it a short "demo document" about the capabilities we've been exploring, to tie it back.</p>
<div dir="auto" class="not-prose"><div class="relative not-prose @container/code-block [&amp;_div+div]:!mt-0 mb-3 mt-3 @md:-mx-4 @md:-mr-4" data-testid="code-block"><div class="border not-prose relative [&amp;_pre]:overflow-auto [&amp;_pre]:rounded-b-lg [&amp;_pre]:px-4 [&amp;_pre]:py-4 !p-0" style="border-radius: 0px 0px 12px 12px; border-top: none; border-right-color: ; border-right-style: ; border-right-width: ; border-bottom-color: ; border-bottom-style: ; border-bottom-width: ; border-left-color: ; border-left-style: ; border-left-width: ; border-image-source: ; border-image-slice: ; border-image-width: ; border-image-outset: ; border-image-repeat: ; padding: 0px 16px 16px; margin-top: 0px; font-size: 0.9em; font-family: var(--font-ibm-plex-mono); line-height: 1.5em; background-color: hsl(var(--surface-inset)); color: var(--fg-primary); display: block; overflow: auto;"><pre class="shiki slack-dark" tabindex="0" style="background-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(230, 230, 230);"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(86, 156, 214); font-weight: bold;"># Grok Capabilities Demo Document</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(86, 156, 214); font-weight: bold;">**Date:**</span><span style="color: rgb(230, 230, 230);"> January 07, 2026  </span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(86, 156, 214); font-weight: bold;">**Author:**</span><span style="color: rgb(230, 230, 230);"> Grok (in conversation)  </span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(86, 156, 214); font-weight: bold;">**Purpose:**</span><span style="color: rgb(230, 230, 230);"> Illustrate what can be expressed in markdown within this interface.</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(86, 156, 214); font-weight: bold;">## 1. Introduction</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(230, 230, 230);">This document demonstrates elements we can include:</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(103, 150, 230);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(230, 230, 230);"> Text formatting</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(103, 150, 230);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(230, 230, 230);"> Structural organization</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(103, 150, 230);">-</span><span style="color: rgb(230, 230, 230);"> Embedded examples (code, tables, lists)</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(230, 230, 230);">It's generated on the fly—no external file, just markdown rendered here.</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(86, 156, 214); font-weight: bold;">## 2. Code Block Example</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(230, 230, 230);">```python</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(197, 134, 192);">import</span><span style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212);"> datetime</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212);">today = datetime.date(</span><span style="color: rgb(181, 206, 168);">2026</span><span style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212);">, </span><span style="color: rgb(181, 206, 168);">1</span><span style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212);">, </span><span style="color: rgb(181, 206, 168);">7</span><span style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212);">)</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(220, 220, 170);">print</span><span style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212);">(</span><span style="color: rgb(86, 156, 214);">f</span><span style="color: rgb(206, 145, 120);">"Current date in demo: </span><span style="color: rgb(86, 156, 214);">{</span><span style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212);">today</span><span style="color: rgb(86, 156, 214);">}</span><span style="color: rgb(206, 145, 120);">"</span><span style="color: rgb(212, 212, 212);">)</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: rgb(106, 153, 85);"># Output: Current date in demo: 2026-01-07</span></span></code></pre></div><div></div></div><div class="false flex flex-col gap-2 h-full"></div></div></div>
<h2 dir="auto" class="text-2xl mt-[1.5em]" node="[object Object]">3. Data Grid (Table)</h2>

<h2 dir="auto" class="text-2xl mt-[1.5em]" node="[object Object]">4. Key Constraints</h2>
<blockquote dir="auto" class="my-1 border-border-l3 [&amp;_p]:before:content-none [&amp;_p]:after:content-none" node="[object Object]"><p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">"The system can render rich markdown, but certain boundaries remain: no native file attachments, no direct PDF rendering, no persistent external documents."</p></blockquote>
<h3 dir="auto" class="text-xl" node="[object Object]">Unordered List of Tools Touched So Far</h3>
<ul dir="auto" class="marker:text-secondary" node="[object Object]">
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Code execution (REPL)</li>
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Image generation</li>
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Chart rendering (possible but not used here)</li>
<li class="break-words whitespace-pre-wrap [&amp;&gt;ul]:whitespace-normal [&amp;&gt;ol]:whitespace-normal" node="[object Object]">Web/X searches (available when needed)</li>
</ul>
<h2 dir="auto" class="text-2xl mt-[1.5em]" node="[object Object]">5. Closing Note</h2>
<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;">This is as "document-like" as I can make it within the conversation. If you want it longer, more specific (e.g., a resume template, report structure, technical spec), or exported somehow—that last part hits a wall. We could refine the content iteratively.</p>
<p dir="auto" class="break-words last:mb-0" node="[object Object]" style="white-space: pre-wrap;"><strong class="font-semibold" node="[object Object]">End of Document</strong></p>
